_header: England is right good I ween it is land best
Note: For the B text, see 1194; for the C text see 1195.
_description: Robert of Gloucester’s Chronicle, A text — in couplets

BLAdd18631.First Lines:
ENgelond is a welgod lond y wene of al londis it is bestIt is set
                    in on nend of þe worlde os in þeo north west…
BLAdd18631.Last Lines:
…Anende aforce wrynge for ȝut he cont moThen was that
                    lond in pes with outon dysturbance
BLAdd18631.Note:
12014 lines; ‘os’ in line 2 is probably a scribal miscopying
                    of ‘al’.

BLAdd19677.First Lines:
…Vif hundred & seuene & fourty as me telle canAfter
                    kyng arthur hit was & þo was kenryk…
BLAdd19677.Last Lines:
…Of þe clergie at londone at seynt andrewes fetteA
                    conseil he made & schewede þere þe popes hest

BLAdd50848.First Lines:
[Mid] humber kynges goude þat me of his londe[Þo f]onde
                    he þre damesels gent & fair y nou…
BLAdd50848.Last Lines:
…& flowe to se to hore schipes & of scaped
                    vnneþeTo scotlond hy wende al by water & þere hy gonne
                    aryue
BLAdd50848.Note:
Six leaves only, with equivalent of lines 561-630; 1467-1676; 1817-1955
                    of London,  British Library Cotton Caligula A.XI text; see Hill (1965)
XHill,  Betty. 
             “A Collation of the Robert of Gloucester Fragments: British Museum MS.
                Add. 50848.” 
             Notes and Queries
         n.s. 12 [210] (1965): 47-9, 47-9. Corner
                    of first folio is ripped out, presumably to remove an illuminated
                    initial.

BLCottCalAXI.First Lines:
Engelond his a wel god lond ich wene ech londe bestIset in þe
                    on ende of þe worlde as al in þe west…
BLCottCalAXI.Last Lines:
…im þoru out wiþ is suerd & villiche him
                    slou…at of holichurche me þincþ wiþ vil
                    wou
BLCottCalAXI.Note:
12049 lines; and 34 lines copied later from now lost Allen
                    MS.
BLCottCalAXI.Attributed Title:
Roberti Glocectrensis Historia rhthmis Anglicanis (table of
                    contents, f. 2)

BLHar201.First Lines:
Englond ys a wel god lond ich wene of eche lond bestY set in
                    þe ende of þe world as al in þe west…
BLHar201.Last Lines:
…þat noman bite þe pope one hem asoyly ne
                    myȝteSo þat me huld clerkes þerafter bet to
                    ryȝte
BLHar201.Editions:
Hearne,  Thomas,
                        ed.  
             Robert of Gloucester’s Chronicle.
         Oxford: at the Theatre, 1724; repr. 1810: 1-464 from this MS.

GULHun415.First Lines:
England is a well good londe in the stead bestset in the one ende
                    of the world & renneth west…
GULHun415.Last Lines:
…And thenne out with is Swerd & velliche him slouAnd of
                    holichurche me thinke with vil won
GULHun415.Note: Last 26 lines added by another hand.
GULHun415.Attributed Title: Robarte of Glocester his Chronicle (added by later hand, f. 1)
